contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. It might be best to translate so the reader understands that other people might have helped Cyrus get the message to the people over whom he ruled. AT: "what Cyrus wrote and what his messengers read so people could hear them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This can be translated in active form. You may need to make explicit whom and what Yahweh had commanded. AT: "as Yahweh had commanded them to do in the law of Moses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: as commanded in the law of Moses

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "whom the Babylonians had taken into exile" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be translated in active form. AT: "if they build the city and complete the wall" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: if this city is built and the wall is completed

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form, in which case you will need to make explicit who translated and read the letter to the king. AT: "I have had my servants translate and read the letter that you sent to me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The letter that you sent me has been translated and read

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form, in which case you will need to make explicit who read the decree from the king to the officials. AT: "The messengers from King Artaxerxes read his decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This can be translated in active form. AT: "for an official to send a letter to the king and for the king to send a letter back to them with a decree" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for a letter to be sent to the king and for a decree to be returned to them

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "that the great king of Israel had built and supplied all the equipment for" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that had been built many years ago when the great king of Israel built it and completed it

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I want the Judeans to rebuild the house of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Let the house of God be rebuilt

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "people are now constructing it, but they have not done all the work yet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it is being constructed, but is not yet complete

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I would like you to have someone investigate this matter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

This can be stated in active form. AT: "they found a scroll" or "they found a scroll that told about Darius and Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "Use funds from the king's tribute beyond the river to pay these men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Funds from the king's tribute beyond the River will be used to pay these men

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "I command my officials to pull a beam from his house and impale him on it. They are then to turn his house into a rubbish heap" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a beam must be pulled from his house and he must be impaled on it. His house must then be turned into a rubbish heap

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. You may need to make explicit which house they completed. AT: "They completed God's house" or "They finished building the temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be expressed in active form. AT: "the objects that we have freely given to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the objects that were freely given to you

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the twelve priestly officials weighed out the silver, gold and objects" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the silver, gold, and objects were weighed out

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form and as separate sentences. AT: "at the time that you will determine. Let them come with the city elder and the city judges" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: at the time that will be fixed with the city elders and the city judges
